intro: Taphrospermum fontanum subsp. microspermum, commonly known as the small-seeded taphrospermum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Capparaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its small, green, succulent leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It has a shallow root system adapted to survive in dry conditions, and its seeds are small and numerous, aiding in its dispersal. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and ecological role in its native habitat.
